element.name: name
element.label: GABQ Input Name
element.key: Name of this GABQ Input

element.name: endpoint
element.label: Endpoint URL
element.key: URL to send the HTTP GET request to

element.name: http_method
element.label: HTTP Method
element.key: HTTP method to use.Defaults to GET. POST and PUT are not really RESTful for requesting data from the API, but useful to have the option for target APIs that are "REST like"

element.name: request_payload
element.label: Request Payload
element.key: Request payload for POST and PUT HTTP Methods

element.name: auth_type
element.label: Authentication Type
element.key: Authentication method to use

element.name: auth_user
element.label: Authentication User
element.key: Authentication user for BASIC or DIGEST auth

element.name: auth_password
element.label: Authentication Password
element.key: Authentication password for BASIC or DIGEST auth

element.name: custom_auth_handler
element.label: Custom Authentication Handler
element.key: Python classname of custom auth handler

element.name: custom_auth_handler_args
element.label: Custom Authentication Handler Arguments
element.key: Custom Authentication Handler arguments string , key=value,key2=value2

element.name: oauth1_client_key
element.label: OAUTH 1 Client Key
element.key: OAUTH 1 client key

element.name: oauth1_client_secret
element.label: OAUTH 1 Client Secret
element.key: OAUTH 1 client secret

element.name: oauth1_access_token
element.label: OAUTH 1 Access Token
element.key: OAUTH 1 access token

element.name: oauth1_access_token_secret
element.label: OAUTH 1 Access Token Secret
element.key: OAUTH 1 access token secret

element.name: oauth2_token_type
element.label: OAUTH 2 Token Type
element.key: OAUTH 2 token type, defaults to "Bearer"

element.name: oauth2_access_token
element.label: OAUTH 2 Access Token
element.key: OAUTH 2 access token

element.name: oauth2_refresh_token
element.label: OAUTH 2 Refresh Token
element.key: OAUTH 2 refresh token

element.name: oauth2_refresh_url
element.label: OAUTH 2 Token Refresh URL
element.key: OAUTH 2 token refresh URL

element.name: oauth2_refresh_props
element.label: OAUTH 2 Token Refresh Properties
element.key: OAUTH 2 token refresh properties : key=value,key2=value2

element.name: oauth2_client_id
element.label: OAUTH 2 Client ID
element.key: OAUTH 2 client ID

element.name: oauth2_client_secret
element.label: OAUTH 2 Client Secret
element.key: OAUTH 2 client secret

element.name: oauth2_refresh_interval
element.label: OAUTH 2 Token Refresh Interval
element.key: OAUTH 2 token refresh interval

element.name: http_header_propertys
element.label: HTTP Header Properties
element.key: Custom HTTP header properties : key=value,key2=value2

element.name: url_args
element.label: URL Arguments
element.key: Custom URL arguments : key=value,key2=value2

element.name: response_type
element.label: Response Type
element.key: Rest Data Response Type, defaults to text

element.name: response_handler
element.label: Response Handler
element.key: Python classname of custom response handler, defaults to DefaultResponseHandler

element.name: response_handler_args
element.label: Response Handler Arguments
element.key: Response Handler arguments string , key=value,key2=value2

element.name: response_filter_pattern
element.label: Response Filter Pattern
element.key: Python Regex pattern, if present , the response will be scanned for this match pattern, and indexed if a match is present

element.name: streaming_request
element.label: Streaming Request ?
element.key: Whether or not this is a HTTP streaming request, defaults to false

element.name: index_error_response_codes
element.label: Index Error Responses
element.key: Whether or not to index error response codes, defaults to false

element.name: http_proxy
element.label: HTTP Proxy Address
element.key: HTTP proxy address, ie: http://10.10.1.10:3128 or http://user:pass@10.10.1.10:3128

element.name: https_proxy
element.label: HTTPs Proxy Address
element.key: HTTPs proxy address,ie: https://10.10.1.10:3128 or https://user:pass@10.10.1.10:3128

element.name: request_timeout
element.label: Request Timeout
element.key: Request Timeout in seconds , defaults to 30

element.name: backoff_time
element.label: Backoff Time
element.key: Time in seconds to wait for retry after error or timeout , defaults to 10

element.name: polling_interval
element.label: Polling Interval
element.key: Polling interval in seconds , defaults to 60

element.name: delimiter
element.label: Delimiter
element.key: Delimiter to use for any multi "key=value" field inputs, defaults to ','

element.name: sourcetypeFields
spl-ctrl_sourcetypeSelect
element.label: Set sourcetype
element.key: [[ e for e in ['sourcetype'] if form_defaults.get(e) ][0]]
[[ e for e in ['sourcetype'] if form_defaults.get(e) ][0]]

element.name: sourcetype
element.label: Source type
element.key: If this field is left blank, the default value of script will be used for the source type.
_('script') if (value==None or value=='') else value
form_data.get('spl-ctrl_from_list') if form_data.get('spl-ctrl_sourcetypeSelect')=='spl-ctrl_from_list' else value if form_data.get('spl-ctrl_sourcetypeSelect')=='sourcetype' else None
form_data.get('spl-ctrl_from_list') if form_data.get('spl-ctrl_sourcetypeSelect')=='spl-ctrl_from_list' else value if form_data.get('spl-ctrl_sourcetypeSelect')=='sourcetype' else None

element.name: spl-ctrl_from_list
element.label: Select source type from list
element.key: Splunk classifies all common data types automatically, but if you're looking for something specific, you can find more source types in the Splunkbase apps browser or online at www.splunkbase.com.
Source type
Set sourcetype field for all events from this source.

element.name: hostFields
element.key: Host

element.name: indexField
element.key: Index
Set the destination index for this source.

element.name: eai:acl.app
element.label: App
element.key: entity['eai:acl']['app'] or ""
